question_description.33:
The Ibex 35 is the main stock market index of the Madrid Stock Exchange. It serves as a key barometer of the Spanish economy, reflecting national and international economic conditions. The composition of the index can be explored in detail [ <u>on Wikipedia</u> ](https://es.wikipedia.org/wiki/IBEX_35) <u>.</u>
 After leading the growth of EU stock markets in 2023 with a 23% increase, the IBEX 35 has remained near the top of the table in 2024, rising by 14.78%. It was the [ <u>second best-performing stock market index among major European markets</u> ](https://www.bolsasymercados.es/docs/infmercado/2024/ing/Market-Report-BME-2024.pdf).
question_description.34:
Impoundment Control Act: [https://uscode.house.gov/view.xhtml?path=/prelim@title2/chapter17B\&edition=prelim](https://uscode.house.gov/view.xhtml?path=/prelim@title2/chapter17B\&edition=prelim)



The [<u>Impoundment Control Act (ICA) was passed in 1974</u>](https://ballotpedia.org/Congressional_Budget_and_Impoundment_Control_Act_of_1974) in response to the impoundment (or withholding) of congressionally allocated funds to programs that then-President Nixon opposed. It requires the President to disclose a formal intent to impound funds, at which point Congress has a brief period to vote to condone the impoundment. If the vote fails (or Congress doesn't vote), the Act requires the President to make the funding available.



Recently, President Trump issued an executive order to [<u>pause up to \$3 trillion in federal grants and loans</u>](https://time.com/7210782/trump-freezes-federal-aid-impoundment/), aiming to review and potentially eliminate certain initiatives. This action has led to legal challenges, with critics arguing that it violates the ICA by withholding funds for policy reasons not authorized under the Act.
question_description.35:
The federal budget process in the United States begins with the passage of a [budget resolution](https://www.cbpp.org/research/introduction-to-budget-reconciliation#how-does-congress-start-the-cbpp-anchor) — a concurrent resolution passed by both the House and Senate that sets broad fiscal targets for spending, revenue, the deficit, and debt levels. While it provides a framework for the upcoming fiscal year, it does not become law and does not require the president’s signature. Importantly, the budget resolution may include reconciliation instructions, which direct specific congressional committees to draft legislation that meets the resolution’s fiscal goals. These instructions are optional but allow for the creation of a [reconciliation bill](https://www.cbpp.org/research/introduction-to-budget-reconciliation), which allows the Senate to pass certain budget-related laws with a simple majority vote and limited debate, bypassing the [filibuster](https://www.senate.gov/about/powers-procedures/filibusters-cloture.htm).

If reconciliation instructions are included, the resulting reconciliation bill must be passed by both chambers and signed by the president to become law. It can include changes to spending, revenue, or the debt limit, but is restricted by rules such as the [Byrd Rule](https://www.cbpp.org/research/introduction-to-budget-reconciliation#what-is-the-byrd-rule-cbpp-anchor), which prohibits provisions unrelated to budget changes. If the budget resolution does not include reconciliation instructions, Congress must enact any fiscal changes through the regular legislative process. In this case, changes to [discretionary spending](https://fiscaldata.treasury.gov/americas-finance-guide/federal-spending/#the-difference-between-mandatory-discretionary-and-supplemental-spending) are made through the annual appropriations bills, which fund specific government departments and require presidential approval. Changes to mandatory spending programs (like Medicare, [Medicaid](https://usafacts.org/articles/how-much-of-the-federal-budget-is-mandatory-spending/), or Social Security), however, require standalone legislation that amends the law governing those programs. These also must pass both chambers and be signed by the president, and they generally face a higher procedural hurdle in the Senate due to the possibility of a filibuster.

House and Senate Republicans have passed separate budget resolutions in March and April 2025, with the Senate version calling for approximately \$4 billion in spending cuts, and the House version aiming for \$1.5 trillion in cuts. The total impact on the deficit over 10 years is reported by the Bipartisan Policy Center as follows for the [Senate version](https://bipartisanpolicy.org/explainer/whats-in-the-fy2025-senate-budget-resolution/):

> While the reconciliation bill’s ultimate deficit impact is yet to be determined, the topline instructions in the Senate allow for an up to \$2 trillion deficit increase over 10 years. Due to overlapping instructions between committees and the use of a [“current policy” baseline](https://bipartisanpolicy.org/explainer/the-2025-tax-debate-all-about-that-baseline/), the actual topline is an up to <u>\$5.7 trillion deficit increase</u>.

And for the [House version](https://bipartisanpolicy.org/explainer/whats-in-the-fy2025-house-budget-resolution/):

> Republicans hope to leverage the reconciliation process this year to extend and expand on [expiring tax cuts](https://bipartisanpolicy.org/tax/). While the reconciliation bill’s ultimate deficit impact is yet to be determined, the topline instructions allow for an up to \$3.3 trillion deficit increase over 10 years.

President Trump has so far [backed the Senate version](https://www.cbsnews.com/news/trump-johnson-urge-gop-to-back-budget-resolution/), though there is some opposition to this version among House Republicans.

The [Congressional Budget Office](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Congressional_Budget_Office) (CBO) is required to produce [cost estimates](https://www.cbo.gov/cost-estimates) for many bills passed by Congress, and [uses a current-law baseline](https://www.pgpf.org/article/why-do-budget-baselines-matter/), as opposed to a current-policy baseline. For example, for the 2022 [Inflation Reduction Act](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Inflation_Reduction_Act), the most recently enacted reconciliation bill as of April 2025, CBO [estimated](https://www.cbo.gov/publication/58455) a net decrease in the deficit from changes to direct spending and revenue of approximately \$58 billion over 10 years, as well as a nonscorable increase in revenue from IRS enforcement of \$180 billion, a total estimated decrease of \$238 billion decrease in the deficit over 10 years.
question_description.36:
The Republicans achieved a "legislative trifecta" in the 2024 elections - control of the White House, Senate, and House of Representatives - although lacking the 60-vote Senate supermajority, having won 53 out of 100 seats.

In the immediate aftermath of the election, senior Republicans began [planning](https://www.politico.com/live-updates/2024/11/25/congress/gop-leaders-meet-to-talk-reconciliation-00191590) how to turn Donald Trump's extensive legislative agenda into reality. One option would include the use of budget [reconciliation](https://www.cbo.gov/topics/budget/reconciliation#:~:text=Budget%20reconciliation%20is%20an%20expedited,in%20a%20Congressional%20budget%20resolution.), a process that allows certain federal budget bills to pass in the Senate with only a simple majority, bypassing the 60-vote threshold typically required to overcome a [filibuster](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Filibuster_in_the_United_States_Senate). Reconciliation also limits debate time, preventing the use of the filibuster altogether.

A key priority expected to be included in a reconciliation bill is the renewal of [Trump’s 2017 tax cuts](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tax_Cuts_and_Jobs_Act) - a central pillar of his campaign, with most of them set to expire at the end of 2025. This is controversial, as it could violate the [Byrd Rule](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reconciliation_\(United_States_Congress\)#Byrd_Rule) if it increases the federal deficit beyond the allowable budget window without offsetting revenue or spending adjustments. Additionally, Trump and the GOP have suggested using reconciliation to pass policies related to border security and energy permitting, though the impact of these measures on federal spending is less clear.

Some senior Republicans argue that border security constitutes a national emergency. In contrast to House Speaker Mike Johnson’s ["one, big beautiful bill"](https://thehill.com/homenews/administration/5067370-mike-johnson-donald-trump-house-gop-reconciliation/), they have proposed using a standalone reconciliation bill to address border security first, followed by a separate bill covering other priorities such as tax policy and the debt ceiling.
question_description.37: Pedro Sánchez is the leader of the Spanish Socialist Workers' Party (PSOE) and has been serving as Prime Minister of Spain since June 2018. Sánchez has run a [ <u>coalition government since 2020</u> ](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Second_Pedro_Sánchez_government), with a [ <u>different configuration following the 2023 elections</u> ](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Third_Pedro_Sánchez_government). Currently, there are no general elections scheduled before the end of 2025. For Sánchez to be removed from office, he would have to resign or face a [ <u>motion of no confidence</u> ](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Motion_of_censure_\(Spain\)), a demanding process in the Spanish political system as it requires an alternative majority.
question_description.38: Global warming and climate phenomena such as El Niño have contributed to exceptionally high temperatures in recent years. 2023 and 2024 were consecutively the warmest years on record. In early 2025, climate models indicate a continued warming trend. For more information, visit the [ <u>Copernicus Climate Change Service</u> ](https://climate.copernicus.eu/). In early 2025, [ <u>real-time data</u> ](https://pulse.climate.copernicus.eu/) suggest that this year is closely following the record warmth of 2024, or slightly below at this stage.
question_description.39:
Pierre Poilievre, leader of the Conservative Party, has gained significant momentum [ <u>by appealing to voters dissatisfied with the current administration</u> ](https://www.ft.com/content/27bd5554-c0f3-4c9f-9682-9c903f38a075) on issues such as housing affordability, inflation and economic recovery. His platform calls for lower taxes, reduced government spending and “putting Canada first.”

 In January 2025, Prime Minister Justin Trudeau [ <u>announced his resignation</u> ](https://www.reuters.com/world/americas/justin-trudeau-announces-plan-step-down-2025-01-06) amid declining popularity and internal party challenges. This political shift has intensified the competitiveness of the upcoming election, with [ <u>recent polls indicating a narrowing gap</u> ](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Opinion_polling_for_the_2025_Canadian_federal_election) between the Conservative and Liberal parties. The election, which must be held no later than October 20, 2025, is expected to focus primarily on economic issues, health care, and Canada’s response to international trade pressures, particularly in light of recent U.S. tariff threats.

 According to updated information, Canada's federal election is scheduled to take place no later than October 20, 2025, under the country's electoral law. [ <u>Source</u> ](https://www.npr.org/2025/01/09/nx-s1-5251302/whats-next-for-canada-5-questions-will-help-decide-the-future-after-trudeau) [ <u>Source</u> ](https://www.reuters.com/world/americas/canadas-main-opposition-leader-poilievre-rides-wave-anti-trudeau-discontent-2025-01-08/)

 Current polls show Pierre Poilievre and the Conservative Party have a significant lead, capitalizing on discontent with the Trudeau government. Following Justin Trudeau's surprise resignation in January 2025, the Canadian political landscape has undergone a major shift that favors Poilievre as the potential next Prime Minister. [ <u>Source</u> ](https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/czjdr98n1kxo)

question_resolution_criteria.0: The question will be resolved as **Yes** if, as of December 31, 2025 (or the previous trading date), Inditex is among the 10 largest companies by market capitalization in the European Union (EU). It will be resolved as **No** if it is below the 10th position or is not listed at all.
question_resolution_criteria.1:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, at any time before September 1, 2025, the DHS formally revokes or suspends the SEVP certification of at least one university in the Ivy League, thereby preventing the affected institution from enrolling new international students under F or M visas.

It will resolve as **No** if no Ivy League SEVP certification is revoked or suspended before that date.
question_resolution_criteria.2: This question will be resolved as **Yes** if, by January 1st, 2026, Bluesky's user count reaches 100 million or more, according to [ <u>Jazco's Bluesky Stats</u> ](https://bsky.jazco.dev/stats) or another credible source. If the reported number is below 100 million, the question will be resolved as **No**.
question_resolution_criteria.3: The question will be resolved as **Yes** if Nvidia's stock price at the close of the last business day of 2025 (on the primary exchange where it is listed, NASDAQ) exceeds $134.29, according to the Close/Last column on [ <u>its NASDAQ page</u> ](https://www.nasdaq.com/market-activity/stocks/nvda/historical). It will be resolved as **No** if it is equal or lower.
question_resolution_criteria.4: This question will resolve as **Yes** if the median price for "Democratic" is higher than the median price for "Republican" on the Kalshi market [*Which party will win the 2028 Presidential Election?*](https://kalshi.com/markets/kxpresparty/party-winning-presidency), for the dates December 25, 2025, to December 31, 2025, inclusive.
question_resolution_criteria.5: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Maersk announces or [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/faq/#definitions) report that shipping through the Red Sea has resumed before January 1, 2026.
question_resolution_criteria.6: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, in the calendar year 2025, Polymarket or Manifold can legally offer markets in the United States using real money.
question_resolution_criteria.7:
The question will resolve as **Yes** if the share price of BP ([BP.L](https://finance.yahoo.com/quote/BP.L/history/)) outperforms Shell ([SHEL.L](https://finance.yahoo.com/quote/SHEL.L/history/)) from June 2, 2025 through July 31, 2025, according to the Close column of Yahoo! Finance.

To resolve the question, the relative share price change between June 2, 2025 (initial) and July 31, 2025 (final) will be calculated for both companies:

$$
\frac{P_{\mathrm{BP},\,\mathrm{final}} - P_{\mathrm{BP},\,\mathrm{initial}}}{P_{\mathrm{BP},\,\mathrm{initial}}}
>  
\frac{P_{\mathrm{SHELL},\,\mathrm{final}} - P_{\mathrm{SHELL},\,\mathrm{initial}}}{P_{\mathrm{SHELL},\,\mathrm{initial}}}
$$
question_resolution_criteria.8: This question will resolve as the cyclist who is officially recognized as the winner of the classement général, or overall winner, in the Tour de France 2025, based on results published on the Tour de France [website](https://www.letour.fr/en/) or other [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).
question_resolution_criteria.9: The question will be resolved as **Yes** if, according to the graph of the average of polls for the General Elections in Spain, maintained by [ <u>Politico Poll of Polls</u> ](https://www.politico.eu/europe-poll-of-polls/spain/), the PSOE is ahead of the PP in the average voting intention for December 31, 2025. It will be resolved as **No** if the PP is ahead of the PSOE or if they are tied.
question_resolution_criteria.10:
This question will resolve as the outcome that is enacted next, before January 1, 2026, with respect to the planned start of the phase-out of the Clean Hydrogen Production Tax Credit (45V) ([26 U.S. Code § 45V](https://energycommunities.gov/funding-opportunity/credit-for-production-of-clean-hydrogen-26-u-s-code-%c2%a7-45v/)).

The outcomes are defined as follows:

**2025-2026 sunset w/o safe harbor**: The planned phase-out date of 45V is moved to 2025 or 2026 or 45V is fully repealed, with no safe harbor for ongoing projects.

**2025-2026 sunset w/ safe harbor**: The planned phase-out date of 45V is moved to 2025 or 2026 or 45V is fully repealed, but with a safe harbor for ongoing projects.

**2027-2028 sunset w/o safe harbor**: The planned phase-out date of 45V is moved to 2027 or 2028, with no safe harbor for ongoing projects.

**2027-2028 sunset w/ safe harbor**: The planned phase-out date of 45V is moved to 2027 or 2028, but with a safe harbor for ongoing projects.

**2029-2031 sunset w/o safe harbor**: The planned phase-out date of 45V is moved to 2029, 2030, or 2031, with no safe harbor for ongoing projects.

**2029-2031 sunset w/ safe harbor**: The planned phase-out date of 45V is moved to 2029, 2030, or 2031, but with a safe harbor for ongoing projects.

If no legislation is enacted before January 1, 2026 that reduces the planned phase-out date of 45V or repeals it, this question will resolve as **No sunset reduction before 2026**.
question_resolution_criteria.11:
This question resolves as **Yes** if legislation is enacted before January 1, 2026 that (according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/faq/#definitions)) eliminates transferability of one or more of the following tax credits: 

* [Clean Electricity Investment Tax Credit – 26 U.S. Code § 48E](https://energycommunities.gov/funding-opportunity/clean-electricity-investment-tax-credit-26-u-s-code-%C2%A4-48e/)
* [Clean Electricity Production Tax Credit – 26 U.S. Code § 45Y](https://energycommunities.gov/funding-opportunity/clean-electricity-production-tax-credit-26-u-s-code-%C2%A4-45y/)
* [Advanced Manufacturing Production Credit – 26 U.S. Code § 45X](https://energycommunities.gov/funding-opportunity/advanced-manufacturing-production-credit-26-u-s-code-%C2%A4-45x/)
question_resolution_criteria.12: The question will be answered as **Yes** if, as of December 31, 2025, the five largest global companies by market capitalization are in the technology sector, according to [ <u>CompaniesMarketCap</u> ](https://companiesmarketcap.com/). It will be answered as **No** if any of the top five are not considered technology companies.
question_resolution_criteria.13: This question will be answered **Yes** if, before January 1, 2026, OpenAI publishes a paper (e.g., a blog post, article, or video, but not a tweet) announcing the existence of GPT-5.
question_resolution_criteria.14: This question will resolve as Yes if [<u>credible sources</u>](https://www.metaculus.com/faq/#definitions) report that President Trump has formally invoked his constitutional authority to adjourn the United States Congress before January 1, 2026.
question_resolution_criteria.15: This question will be resolved to **Yes** if, within 2025, "Grand Theft Auto VI" is available for sale in Europe through standard, authorized distribution channels. If the game is not released in Europe in 2025, the question will be resolved to **No**.
question_resolution_criteria.16:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the US Supreme Court holds in its 2025 decision pertaining to birthright citizenship that the Fourteenth Amendment does **not** require birthright citizenship for at least some children born in the United States who currently qualify.

The question will immediately resolve **No** if the Supreme Court issues an opinion that upholds the status quo of birthright citizenship and Metaculus assesses the opinion reflects a final judgment on the merits.
question_resolution_criteria.17:
This question will resolve as the total decrease in Medicaid spending over the period from fiscal year 2025 to 2034, inclusive, enacted as part of a spending reconciliation bill passed during fiscal year 2025. If no such reconciliation bill is enacted before the end of fiscal year 2025 (before October 1, 2025), this question will be **annulled**.

The question will resolve according to the cost estimate produced by the [Congressional Budget Office](https://www.cbo.gov/) (CBO) for the enacted reconciliation bill.
question_resolution_criteria.18: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, on December 31, 2025, the entry with the highest Arena Score in the Overall category of the [Chatbot Arena LLM Leaderboard](https://lmarena.ai/) has OpenAI as its organization.
question_resolution_criteria.19:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, in calendar year 2025, at least 1,000 deaths have occurred in direct conflict between Iran and Israel, according to reports from [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions). To the extent possible, only deaths caused by and to citizens of each country, members of the military of each country, or people within the borders of each country will be counted toward the 1,000 death threshold.

Direct conflict is defined as conflict between the military forces or law enforcement of Iran and Israel using kinetic, explosive, chemical, or nuclear means and all deaths caused by such a conflict count, including civilians. Deaths from attacks by or towards proxies (e.g., Iran's proxy Hezbollah) do not count for the resolution of this question.
question_resolution_criteria.20:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, at any time before January 1, 2026, the Department of Justice (DOJ) files a federal criminal [indictment](https://thelawdictionary.org/indictment/) against Christopher Krebs or Miles Taylor, former officials from President Trump’s first administration.

It will resolve as **No** if no such indictment is filed by that time.
question_resolution_criteria.21: This question will resolve as Yes if [<u>credible sources</u>](https://www.metaculus.com/faq/#definitions) report that President Trump has formally invoked the Insurrection Act before January 1, 2026.
question_resolution_criteria.22:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before January 1, 2026, the United States has enacted one or more bills that changes at least three of the six following components of the Affordable Care Act (ACA) to either repeal or curtail them (see the fine print for fuller details):

* Eliminates or reduces the ACA's Medicaid eligibility or federal funding
* Eliminates or reduces the premium tax credit eligibility or amount
* Eliminates or curtails the individual mandate (by law the individual mandate still exists in the ACA, but has no penalty)
* Eliminates or curtails the mandate for certain employers to provide health coverage for employees. Reducing the penalties will also be considered to be relaxing the mandate.
* Makes it so that ACA subsidies are no longer limited to plans that satisfy the requirements specified in the ACA, including allowing ACA subsidies to be contributed to health savings accounts or similar account
* Eliminates or curtails medical underwriting restrictions
question_resolution_criteria.23: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, according to [the National Institute of Statistics and Censuses of Argentina (INDEC)](https://www.indec.gob.ar/indec/web/Nivel3-Tema-4-46), the percentage of the population living below the poverty line in Argentina (*Población bajo la línea de pobreza*) in the first half of 2025 is less than 41.7%. If the percentage is greater than or equal to 41.7%, this question resolves as **No**.
question_resolution_criteria.24:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if any of the following happens after December 31, 2024 before January 1, 2026:

* A New Drug Application (NDA) for the treatment of a mental disorder (as defined by the [Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Illnesses](https://my.clevelandclinic.org/health/articles/24291-diagnostic-and-statistical-manual-dsm-5), the DSM-5) is filed to the FDA for a psychedelic.
* An application for an Emergency Use Authorization (EUA) for the treatment of a mental disorder (as defined by the DSM-5) is filed to the FDA for a psychedelic.
* The DEA reschedules any psychedelic under the U.S. Controlled Substances Act to a less restrictive schedule (e.g., from Schedule I to Schedule II).

For the purposes of this questions, a psychedelic is defined broadly and includes:

* psychedelic indolealkylamines(e.g. LSD, psilocybin, DMT)
* psychedelic phenylethylamines (e.g. mescaline, MDMA, the 2C series)
* arylcycloalkylamines with psychedelic or dissociative effects (e.g. PCP, ketamine)
* Salvinorin A

Cannabinoids (e.g. THC) are *not* considered psychedelics for the purposes of this question.
question_resolution_criteria.25: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Google's market share for any month during calendar year 2025 is below 85%, according to [Statcounter](https://gs.statcounter.com/search-engine-market-share).
question_resolution_criteria.26:
This question will resolve as Yes if [<u>credible sources</u>](https://www.metaculus.com/faq/#definitions) report that the U.S. Department of Justice (DOJ) announces a new investigation or prosecution of a high-profile Democrat, which is for purposes of this question defined as an individual who meets any of the following criteria before January 1, 2026:

\- Has served as Democratic President or Vice President of the United States.

\- Has held any of the following leadership roles in the House of Representatives or Senate (Speaker of the House or House Minority/Democratic Leader, Senate Majority or Minority/Democratic Leader, House or Senate Majority/Democratic Whip).

-Has served as an impeachment manager during either of the impeachment proceedings against Donald Trump (2019–2020 or 2020–2021). The 2019-2020 impeachment managers were Adam Schiff, Jerry Nadler, Zoe Lofgren, Hakeem Jeffries, Val Demings, Sylvia Garcia, and Jason Crow. The 2020-2021 impeachment managers were Jamie Raskin, Diana DeGette, David Cicilline, Joaquin Castro, Eric Swalwell, Ted Lieu, Stacey Plaskett, Madeline Dean, and Joe Neguse.
question_resolution_criteria.27:
*Note: This question draws on forthcoming 2024 data to align with the Future Perfect forecast.*

This question will resolve as **Yes** if the 2024 total kilograms of medically important antimicrobial drugs sold or distributed for use in food-producing animals in the US is at least 0.5% higher than the same number for 2023.
question_resolution_criteria.28:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if any of the following happen before September 1, 2025:

1. Kemi Badenoch formally announces her intention to resign.
2. Kemi Badenoch loses an internal vote confidence held by the 1922 committee.
3. A leadership election is held to elect the leader of the Conservative Party, even if Kemi Badenoch is a candidate.
question_resolution_criteria.29: This question will resolve as Yes if [<u>credible sources</u>](https://www.metaculus.com/faq/#definitions) report that the current Senate parliamentarian, Elizabeth MacDonough, has been removed from office or resigned before July 1, 2025.
question_resolution_criteria.30:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before September 1, 2025, credible sources report that a formal investigation has been opened into financial misconduct relating to tariff announcements between April 2 and April 9, 2025 by any of:

* Department of Justice (DOJ)
* Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC)
* a Congressional Oversight committee

If no public reports available before September 1, 2025 indicate this has occurred, the question resolves as **No**.
question_resolution_criteria.31: This question will resolve as the US per capita consumption of chicken for 2025, according to the [National Chicken Council](https://www.nationalchickencouncil.org/statistic/per-capita-consumption-poultry/). Specifically, it will resolve as the value for "Total Chicken" given for 2025 when that is no longer an estimate.
question_resolution_criteria.32: This question will resolve as **Yes** if any single participant of the current, Summer 2025 Metaculus Cup earns at least \$750 in commenting prizes.
question_resolution_criteria.33: The question will be resolved as **Yes** if the official closing value of the Ibex 35 on the last business day of 2025 (normally December 31st or the previous session if it falls on a holiday) exceeds 11,595.00, according to the Close column of [ <u>its page on Yahoo Finance</u> ](https://uk.finance.yahoo.com/quote/%5EIBEX/history/). It will be resolved as **No** if the value is equal to or less than €11,595.00.
question_resolution_criteria.34: This question will resolve as Yes if a federal judge issues a decision finding the Trump administration in violation of the Impoundment Control Act (2 U.S.C. §§ 681–688) for attempting to permanently withhold or cancel congressionally allocated funds before September 30, 2025.
question_resolution_criteria.35:
This question will resolve as the total increase in the deficit over the period from fiscal year 2025 to 2034, inclusive, enacted as part of spending and revenue reconciliation bill(s) passed during fiscal year 2025. **This includes both direct and nonscorable effects.** If no such reconciliation bill(s) are enacted before the end of fiscal year 2025 (before October 1, 2025), this question will be **annulled**.

The question will resolve according to the cost estimate produced by the [Congressional Budget Office](https://www.cbo.gov/cost-estimates) (CBO) for the enacted reconciliation bill.
question_resolution_criteria.36:
This question will resolve as the 2025 period in which the US Congress has successfully passed *any* bill via the special parliamentary procedure of reconciliation and said bill is signed by the President into law.

Should no such bill be passed and signed before January 1, 2026, this question will resolve as **Not in 2025**.
question_resolution_criteria.37: The question will be answered as **Yes** if Pedro Sánchez holds the office of Prime Minister of Spain at the end of the day on December 31, 2025. It will be answered as **No** if he does not hold that office at that time. Confirmation will be based on official sources.
question_resolution_criteria.38: The question will be resolved as **Yes** if the [Copernicus Climate Change Service/ECMWF](https://climate.copernicus.eu) reports that 2025 was the warmest year on record based on global mean surface air temperature. It will be resolved as **No** if any other year holds the record.
question_resolution_criteria.39: The question will be resolved as **Yes** if, following the 2025 federal election in Canada, Pierre Poilievre is officially appointed Prime Minister. If this does not happen, this question will be resolved as **No**. This includes no election being held before January 1, 2026, or the results of all 2025 elections being annulled.

question_fine_print.0:
* [ <u>CompaniesMarketCap</u> ](https://companiesmarketcap.com/european-union/largest-companies-in-the-eu-by-market-cap/) or an equivalent reliable source will be used as a reference.
 * If specific data is not available for December 31, 2025, the last year-end closing will be used.
question_fine_print.1:
An announcement or notice of intent alone is not sufficient, the revocation or suspension must take effect.

The Ivy League includes the following institutions: Brown University, Columbia University, Cornell University, Dartmouth College, Harvard University, University of Pennsylvania, Princeton University, and Yale University.

Under the circumstance that a court blocks the revocation or suspension by the DHS, this question will also resolve as **Yes** if the revocation or suspension is enacted in defiance of said court order.

Resolution will be determined based on information published by [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/faq/#definitions).
question_fine_print.2: * If Jazco's Bluesky Stats stops reporting this number and no other credible sources can be found, this question will be **voided**
question_fine_print.3:
* If NASDAQ does not publish this data by January 7, 2026, Yahoo Finance or a credible alternative source will be used.
 * The price will be adjusted in the event of stock splits or reverse splits.
question_fine_print.4:
* This question will resolve based on the CSV downloaded from the market page. The median price will be calculated over all timestamps that belong to the week in question.
* If the medians are equal, this question will resolve as **No**.
* If, for more than 3 days of the relevant week, the market is unavailable or has been halted, this question will be **annulled.**
question_fine_print.5:
* An announcement of a partial resumption of Red Sea activity will resolve this question as **Yes**. Reports of Maersk ships traveling the Red Sea will also resolve the question as **Yes** if, in the judgment of Metaculus, the event represents a change to official Maersk policy, allowing its ships to travel through the Red Sea.
* Reports that this will happen at some point in the future will only resolve this question as **Yes** if that point is within the calendar year 2025 *and* that date is reached without a significant change in plans.
question_fine_print.6:
* This has to be legal in at least one US state.
* A public change in law or government policy must occur for this to resolve as **Yes**, which could include but is not limited to court decisions, public CFTC [<u>no-action letters</u>](https://www.cftc.gov/LawRegulation/CFTCStaffLetters/index.htm), executive orders, or new laws. For example, if Manifold or Polymarket were to decide to accept risk under the status quo, satisfying the other criteria with no preceding change in law or government policy, that would not be sufficient. In the event the circumstances are unclear Metaculus may resolve the question as **ambiguous**.
* For the purposes of this question, real money includes anything that can be legally exchanged for fiat currency. For example, if Polymarket launched "Polymarket chips" that one could at any point legally both buy and sell using USD and it was legal to bet on Polymarket using those chips, this question would resolve as **Yes** (in the same way that gambling in a casino with chips is gambling with real money). Similarly any legal cryptocurrencies or crypto tokens (e.g., USDC) would resolve this question as **Yes**.
* If Polymarket or Manifold markets operate using a custom currency (e.g., Manifold sweepcash), to resolve as **Yes** they have to explicitly state that users can exchange fiat currency for the custom currency and vice versa. Manifold's workaround that gives "free" sweepcash for mana purchases does not suffice to resolve this question as **Yes**. 
* Polymarket or Manifold restricting withdrawals only to money that has been previously traded would *not* prevent this question from resolving as **Yes**. A restriction that would allow only money that has been won from a market resolution to be withdrawn, however, *would* prevent this question from resolving as **Yes**.
question_fine_print.7:
* In case of any ambiguity, Metaculus may wait for data errors/inaccuracies to be fixed before resolving this question or use alternate credible sources.
* If there is an exact tie this question will resolve as **No**.
* If Shell acquires BP, or vice versa, this question will be **annulled**.
question_fine_print.8:
If a cyclist not named in any option is the winner, the question will resolve as **Other**.

In the [near-impossible](https://www.cyclingnews.com/features/can-the-tour-de-france-end-in-a-tie/) event of a tie after all of the Tour de France's tiebreakers and no single winner of the general classification is declared, this question will be **annulled**.
question_fine_print.9:
• Any changes to Politico’s methodology will not affect the resolution of the question.

 • If Politico has not published a value for December 31, 2025 by January 7, 2025, this question will be resolved based on the most recent value for 2025, as long as it is after November 30, 2025. If no such value is published by December 31, 2025, this question will be **void**.
question_fine_print.10:
* The current law alternatively sunsets when greenhouse gas emissions of the United States are less than or equal to 25% of 2022 emissions. This question concerns only the scheduled year; if the greenhouse gas emission threshold changes but the scheduled sunset year remains 2032 then it will not count, even if the stated purpose or effective outcome is an earlier phasing out of 45V.
* For the purposes of this question, a safe harbor must grandfather in most projects that are ongoing at the time of enactment.
* The question will resolve immediately once the criteria for any outcome are met, even if later developments would satisfy the criteria of another outcome.
question_fine_print.11: "Eliminates transferability" is [defined as](https://www.irs.gov/credits-deductions/register-for-elective-payment-or-transfer-of-credits) qualifying businesses, tax-exempt organizations or entities such as state, local and tribal governments not being able to make a transfer election of a credit received for tax year 2026 for 48E, 45Y, or 45X credits received to an unrelated party. Transferability being eliminated for any reason by legislation enacted before January 1, 2026 (including a credit itself being repealed) will count for this question.
question_fine_print.12:
• For the purposes of this question, technology companies are those on CompaniesMarketCap's [ <u>Largest Tech Companies by Market Cap</u> ](https://companiesmarketcap.com/tech/largest-tech-companies-by-market-cap/) list.

• If CompaniesMarketCap stops publishing this data, an equivalent source showing global market capitalization ranking will be referenced.
question_fine_print.13:
• For the purposes of this question, GPT-5 will be considered to exist if the OpenAI published paper describes some GPT-5 performance results or indicates that GPT-5 has been built. A reference to progress in training or development of GPT-5 will not be sufficient on its own. If OpenAI publishes some GPT-5 performance results and states that GPT-5 is still in some form of training or testing, this question will be resolved as **Yes**.

 • The model must be announced by OpenAI or any entity that legally acquires or merges with OpenAI.

 • If OpenAI does not explicitly refer to a potentially qualified model as GPT-5, Metaculus may determine whether the model is generally considered to be the successor to GPT-4 that was previously described as GPT-5.
question_fine_print.14:
\- “Adjourn” refers to the formal discontinuation of a session of Congress, as defined in Article II, Section 3 of the U.S. Constitution. “Invoke” means Trump formally orders or declares an adjournment under Article II, Section 3 in an official White House document or statement. A statement by Trump saying he could invoke the adjournment power would not qualify. 

\- If President Trump has not formally adjourned Congress before January 1, 2026, Metaculus will resolve this question as No based on information published by [<u>credible sources</u>](https://www.metaculus.com/faq/#definitions).
question_fine_print.15: * Unofficial reservations or leaks do not qualify unless corroborated by an authorized announcement.
question_fine_print.16:
* If the Supreme Court does not issue a decision pertaining to the merits of the [consolidated cases](https://www.supremecourt.gov/orders/courtorders/041725zr1_4gd5.pdf) *Trump v. CASA, Inc*, *Trump v. Washington*, and *Trump v New Jersey* before August 1, 2025, this question will be **annulled**.
* For the purposes of this question, if the Court holds that it is permissible to restrict birthright citizenship while preserving birthright citizenship for some categories (e.g., excluding only children of undocumented parents), that still counts as “restricting” birthright citizenship for the purpose of this question.
* A ruling on procedural issues or tangential topics, such as the permissibility of universal injunctions, is not sufficient on its own. This question is concerned with a ruling issued on the merits of the case. If the Supreme Court denies to hear an appeal related to the merits of birthright citizenship such that Metaculus assesses that the Supreme Court has issued the final judgment on the subject that effectively allows birthright citizenship to be restricted, this question will resolve as **Yes**.
* Allowing a restriction on birthright citizenship to take effect will only resolve the question as **Yes** if Metaculus assesses that the Supreme Court has issued the final judgment on the subject, meaning that legal challenges to the restriction have been largely precluded.
* Metaculus will rely on reporting from credible sources in the event it is unclear whether the Supreme Court has issued a decision giving the final judgment on the merits.
question_fine_print.17:
* This question is asking the amount that spending decreases, for example a decrease in spending of \$1 billion would resolve this question as \$1 billion.
* The value used in the CBO report will be the total cost change for Medicaid, if available, or via summing the "budget authority" line items reported as changing direct spending for Medicaid, or the equivalent if CBO changes their reporting terminology. If Medicaid is combined with another program, such as the Children's Health Insurance Program (CHIP), such that the portion considered to be Medicaid spending cannot be easily determined, such line items will be ignored for the purposes of this question, unless Metaculus determines at its sole discretion that the combined line items make up a sizeable share of the Medicaid spending in which case Metaculus may **annul** the question.
* Metaculus may use reports from [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/faq/#definitions) of the CBO figures. In the event the CBO report is not available within three months after the passage of the bill, or in the event it is unclear how to sum Medicaid line items to arrive at the total Medicaid spending change, Metaculus may use reporting and estimates from other credible sources to resolve this question.
question_fine_print.18:
* An OpenAI model has to have the highest Arena Score. Simply having a rank equal to 1 will not suffice to resolve this question as **Yes**, as models with different Arena Scores can share rank 1. 
* A tie for the highest Arena Score will count.
* The StyleControl option will not be selected for the comparison.
* If Chatbot Arena substantially changes its methodology or categories, Metaculus might correspondingly alter the resolution criteria or **annul** this question.
question_fine_print.19:
* In case of ambiguity, Metaculus admins may wait up to February 1, 2026, to make a determination and may use all information published prior to that date.
* Deaths will be totaled over the entire calendar year.
* If reported death totals do not specify which conflict they occurred in (e.g., a total of Israeli military deaths without disaggregation between conflicts with Iran or Hezbollah), Metaculus may use available estimates to determine whether the threshold has been met.
* Deaths from covert ops or other rumored operations will not count, unless explicitly claimed by one of the countries or conclusively shown by independent parties to have been committed by overtly flagged forces of either military during the specified period.
* Deaths from attacks by and towards the [Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Islamic_Revolutionary_Guard_Corps) will count, as they are a branch of the Iranian Armed Forces.
* Deaths caused by friendly fire do not count, as long as they are explicitly referred to as such by credible sources.
* Deaths caused indirectly, for example as a result of sabotage or cyber-warfare do not count.
* Direct effects of an attack (e.g. fires, building collapses, or other immediate consequences occurring within 24 hours of the attack) would be included in the count. Effects that develop over longer timeframes (e.g. economic disruption) would not be counted.
question_fine_print.20:
Only federal criminal indictments filed by the DOJ are considered.

This question will be resolved according to information published by [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/faq/#definitions) before January 1, 2026.
question_fine_print.21:
\- The invocation must explicitly invoke the Insurrection Act or make reference to the legal provisions under the Act. A statement by Trump saying he could invoke the Act would not qualify. 

\- Metaculus will resolve this question according to [<u>credible sources</u>](https://www.metaculus.com/faq/#definitions).
question_fine_print.22:
Below find an expanded description of the above six criteria with the criteria used to determine if each has occurred:

* One or more of the following changes to Medicaid is implemented
  * Rescinding or reducing federal Medicaid eligibility below 133% of the federal poverty line (effectively 138% of the federal poverty line)
  * Rescinding or reducing the federal medical assistance percentage (FMAP) for newly eligible recipients for states which have expanded Medicaid
  * Reducing or capping the overall amount of Medicaid funding provided under the ACA
  * Imposing new federal requirements on Medicaid eligibility, such as work requirements, that have the effect of reducing the number of people who are currently eligible for Medicaid
* One or more of the following changes is made to premium tax credits
  * Reducing taxpayer eligibility for the credits (the ACA specified that taxpayers with household incomes ranging between 100% and 400% of the federal poverty line were eligible, so a reduction would be narrowing that range by either increasing the minimum eligibility above 100% or lowering the cap below 400%)
  * Reducing or eliminating the premium assistance amount specified in the ACA
  * Imposing additional requirements on premium tax credits that have the effect of reducing the number of people who are currently eligible for premium tax credits
* The individual mandate is eliminated (by law the individual mandate still exists in the ACA, but has no penalty)
* Eliminating or relaxing the mandate for certain employers to provide health coverage for employees. Reducing the penalties will also be considered to be relaxing the mandate.
* Making it so that ACA subsidies are no longer limited to plans that satisfy the requirements specified in the ACA, including allowing ACA subsidies to be contributed to health savings accounts or similar account
* One or more of the following changes is made to the ACA's medical underwriting restrictions:
  * Eliminating or relaxing the ACA's restriction on excluding individuals with pre-existing conditions
  * Expanding the ability of health insurance issuers to price discriminate or set eligibility requirements based on certain characteristics

The above criteria need not be met in a single bill. The question will still resolve as **Yes** if multiple bills are enacted that have the combined effect of satisfying the above criteria.

The ACA is lengthy and complex, and Metaculus will use its judgment to assess legislation that has been passed while also relying on characterizations published in credible sources that Metaculus assesses to be knowledgeable and demonstrate sufficient expertise.

The expiration of [enhanced subsidies](https://www.kff.org/interactive/how-much-more-would-people-pay-in-premiums-if-the-acas-enhanced-subsidies-expired/) passed in other legislation is immaterial; this question only resolves as **Yes** if the above criteria are met with respect to the text of the ACA.

  * "Region": "Worldwide"
  * "Period": "Monthly"

question_fine_print.26:
\- The DOJ must publicly and officially announce the initiation of an investigation or prosecution against the individual.

\- The resolution does not require a conviction or final outcome—only the announcement of a formal investigation or prosecution.

\- For clarity, the question includes impeachment managers formally appointed for Trump’s impeachment proceedings and leadership roles active as of the time of the DOJ’s announcement.

question_fine_print.27:
* This question will resolve based on the first report by the FDA's Center for Veterinary Medicine that includes the full numbers for 2024. If the CVM does not publish the relevant numbers before April 1, 2026, alternative [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/faq/#definitions) might be used, as long as they are roughly consistent with the previously released CVM numbers.
* The relevant number for 2023 was 6,127,991 kg and could be found in CVM's [2023 Summary Report On Antimicrobials Sold or Distributed for Use in Food-Producing Animals](https://www.fda.gov/animal-veterinary/antimicrobial-resistance/2023-summary-report-antimicrobials-sold-or-distributed-use-food-producing-animals), II. Data on All Marketed Drugs (3), Table 2a, as the Subtotal of Medically Important drugs. If CVM, or an alternative credible source in case the CVM does not report these, shows a different number when data for 2024 are published, the updated number will be used.
* If the 2023 number stays at 6,127,991 kg, this question will resolve as **Yes** if the 2024 number is at least 6,158,631 kg.

question_fine_print.29:
\- This question will resolve to Yes only if there is [<u>credible</u>](https://www.metaculus.com/faq/#definitions) and verifiable reporting from reputable sources confirming that Elizabeth MacDonough has either:

1\) Resigned from her position as Senate parliamentarian, or

2\) Been formally removed from the role, or

3\) Lost her role because it has been abolished.

\- A resignation or removal must be official and publicly announced by credible sources such as the Senate, the White House, or other government representatives.

\- If Elizabeth MacDonough temporarily steps down or is temporarily replaced but later returns to the role, the question will resolve as No. If she is not holding office on the resolution date, regardless of whether the intent is for a temporary absence, this question will resolve as Yes. If the position is abolished while she is the holder, the question will resolve as Yes.

question_fine_print.34:
\- The violation must be formally determined in a judicial decision by a federal court before the end of the 2025 fiscal year (September 27, 2025). Preliminary injunctions and temporary restraining orders do not qualify. The resolution of this question will not be affected by subsequent appeals.

\- The ruling must be publicly available and reported by credible legal or governmental sources.

\- Metaculus will resolve this question based on court rulings issued on or before September 27, 2025, Eastern Time, based on information and reporting available via standard web searches.
question_fine_print.35:
* This question is asking the amount that the deficit would increase, for example an increase in the deficit of \$1 billion would resolve this question as \$1 billion.
* The value used in the CBO report will be the net increase or decrease in the deficit, from both direct on-budget and off-budget deficits as well as from any nonscorable deficit effects.
* In the event that the spending and revenue portions are passed as separate reconciliation bills this question will resolve as the combined deficit effect from both bills, combining the total deficit estimates from both bills if necessary.
* Metaculus may use reports from credible sources of the CBO figures to aid in determining resolution. In the event the CBO report is not available within three months after the passage of the later of the spending and revenue portions of the bill, or in the event it is unclear how to arrive at a total deficit increase from the CBO report, Metaculus may use reporting and estimates from other credible sources to resolve this question.
* If the deficit is decreased, this question will resolve as **\<0 \$**. If it is increased more than \$8 trillion, it will resolve as **>8T \$**.
* This question is asked assuming a current-law baseline, in the event CBO reports both current-law and current-policy baselines this question will use the current-law baseline figures, and the question will be **annulled** if CBO does not use a current-law baseline in its cost estimate and such an estimate is unavailable from other credible sources.
question_fine_print.36: The bill must be signed by the president, simply passing Congress is not sufficient to resolve this question.
question_fine_print.37:

 • If Sánchez does not hold office, but is the acting President at the end of the day on December 31, 2025, this question will still be resolved as **No**.
